definition: to harness/to draw (a cart etc)/to drive/to pilot/to sail/to ride/your good self/prefixed word denoting respect (polite 敬辞)
to gallop/speedily/to proceed to/to pilot (ship, plane etc)/to sail

sentences.english: In what direction should the pilot head in order to travel due north ?
sentences.chinese: 爲使這架飛機向正北航行，駕駛員應取什麼航向？

sentences.english: The pilots looked outside the cockpit window and saw that the plane was coated by a thin cloud.
sentences.chinese: 駕駛員注視座艙窗外，看到飛機被一層薄雲覆蓋。

sentences.english: That morning, Pilot Ayanami Rei ran to school.
sentences.chinese: 那天的早晨，駕駛員綾波麗是跑着去的學校。

sentences.english: The pilot said that at the moment everything was blacked out for him.
sentences.chinese: 那位駕駛員說當時他眼前一片漆黑。

sentences.english: A good example of a Warrant Officer is a helicopter pilot.
sentences.chinese: 關於准尉的一個典型例子是直升飛機駕駛員。

sentences.english: The complaint alleged that the driver had committed various negligent acts and omissions .
sentences.chinese: 原告訴稱駕駛員實施了各種疏忽的作爲與不作爲。

sentences.english: The driver delayed the drive until the weather cleared.
sentences.chinese: 駕駛員延遲到天氣轉晴後纔出車。

sentences.english: However, he said the requirements should not be so strict for non-professional drivers.
sentences.chinese: 但他覺得對於非職業駕駛員要求不必過於嚴峻。

sentences.english: The failure of motorists to detect and recognize motorcycles in traffic is the predominating cause of motorcycle accidents.
sentences.chinese: 駕駛員的錯誤判斷是造成摩托車事故的主要因素。

sentences.english: Yachtsmen violations of safety standards may be mainly due to an accident.
sentences.chinese: 遊艇駕駛員違反安全規範可能是事故主要原因。

sentences.english: A driver must be able to read traffic signs.
sentences.chinese: 駕駛員必須能辨認交通標誌。

sentences.english: Drivers have ten days' grace to renew their licenses.
sentences.chinese: 駕駛員更換執照有10天的寬限期。

sentences.english: The pilot of the airplane gunned his engine for a sharp climb.
sentences.chinese: 飛機駕駛員爲使飛機急劇上升而加大發動機的油門。

sentences.english: Some people were trying to help the driver get out of the dwoulmaged car.
sentences.chinese: 有些人試圖協理駕駛員取得損壞的汽車。

sentences.english: Being an anchorman or newsman is a lot like being a pilot.
sentences.chinese: 新聞主持或新聞記者很大程度上相似於一個駕駛員。

definition: to travel along a route (of vehicles etc)
to drive a vehicle/movement of vehicles
to be on duty (of a security guard etc)
to gallop/speedily/to proceed to/to pilot (ship, plane etc)/to sail
to pull up (stop one's vehicle)/to park/(of a machine) to stop working/to stall
